Description: Small, narrow axe-head: with short angular lugs at rear and with slightly incurved sides, which splay at the distal end to form a relatively wide convex cutting edge. The butt is straight and the sides are bevelled. The blade is moderately corroded and is pitted in parts. The cutting edge is damaged. Chased on one face is a hieroglyphic inscription.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. V, Davies, ‘Journal of Egyptian Archaeology’ 60 (London, 1974), 115, n. 12.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (101)
